alert.note: Alert for Bastrop; Bexar; Blanco; Burnet; Caldwell; Comal; Gillespie; Guadalupe; Hays; Kendall; Llano; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 04 at 12:59PM CDT until August 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Increased Fire Danger Continues Across South Central Texas... .A combination of critically to extremely dry fuels and elevated fire weather conditions continue to support wildfires with high resistance to control, per guidance from the Texas A&M Forest Service. Based on these observed impacts, and the continued persistence of critically to extremely dry fuels, a Red Flag Warning continues for this afternoon over portions of Hill Country and the I-35 Corridor. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE HILL COUNTRY AND THE I35 CORRIDOR... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT SATURDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE HILL COUNTRY AND THE I35 CORRIDOR... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM CDT Saturday. * WINDS...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly and exhibit high resistance to control. Any outdoor activity that could produce flames or sparks is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
